name: Single-Leg Deadlift
setup: Hold dumbbell in opposite hand to standing leg
Stand on one leg with slight knee bend
Keep chest tall and shoulders back
steps: Initiate movement by pushing hips back
Hinge at hip while extending free leg behind
Lower dumbbell toward floor while maintaining straight back
Feel stretch in hamstring of standing leg
Drive through heel to return to standing position
Keep free leg in line with torso throughout
cues: Keep back straight and chest proud
Free leg extends behind, not to side
Control the descent, drive up through heel
mistakes: Allowing knee of standing leg to cave inward
Rounding back instead of hinging at hips
Using free leg as kickstand for balance
Dropping dumbbell straight down vs. reaching back
safety: Start with bodyweight only until balance is established. Use wall or rack for light support if needed. Focus on movement quality over load.

regressions: Hand on wall for light support
Romanian deadlift with toe tap back

variations: Romanian deadlift with rear leg elevated

prescriptionHints.notes: Focus on balance and control. Build load gradually.

joints.notes: Challenges ankle stability and hip mobility. Maintain neutral spine throughout.
